article_title: Work Continues to Restore Baja California After Hurricane
article_text:
MEXICO CITY—In the week since the Baja California peninsula was ravaged by Hurricane Odile, work continues to repair damage, restore services and reactivate the local economy, the government said Monday.

As of Sunday, close to 27,000 people had been airlifted out of Baja California Sur state on military and commercial aircraft, the Communications and Transport Ministry said.

Most of the flights were from the Los Cabos tourism...
